meanings.definition: Fail to keep up with another or others in movement or development.
meanings.sent1: During the race, I started to lag behind the other runners.
meanings.sent2: The internet connection can lag when too many people are using it at once.
meanings.sent3: I always lag behind in the game, but it's still fun to play.
meanings.sent4: Her tiredness made her mind lag behind, unable to focus on the task at hand.
meanings.sent5: The old car engine would lag when trying to accelerate quickly.

meanings.definition: A period of time between one event or phenomenon and another.
meanings.sent1: There was a lag between the lightning and the thunder during the storm.
meanings.sent2: After pressing the button, there was a slight lag before the screen changed.
meanings.sent3: The lag between the announcement and the actual event made everyone anxious.
meanings.sent4: The lag in communication caused confusion among the team members.
meanings.sent5: The lag in the video stream made it difficult to follow the presentation.
